website_summaries.verdict: The large display along with quadruple the resolution of standard HD, amazing picture quality, and a sleek design create a superior viewing experience.
pros: Monitor stand is stable and adjustable to user's comfort level
can also be tilted up and down
Great for multiple uses, from spreadsheets to movies to gaming
Large enough to use 2 programs or browsers simultaneously
Easy to set up right out of the box
cons: will need to use audio output for sound
Multiple steps required when changing monitor options with front-panel buttons

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Bought it, and was happy with it at first, then realized black lines whenever it was on a gray tint and clouding. The majority of my work programs are gray, Photoshop, Maya, even Reddit, Twitch and a lot of other programs have optional gray tints so you're not staring at white all day. Returned it and got a replacement, this time white lines and a white splotch on the right side of the screen. I used to be a Samsung fanboy, but after returning a monitor twice, and returning a TV 3 times because of constant quality control issues I'm done buying their products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Screen Flickers, disappointing customer service from Samsung and Amazon
customer_reviews.text: The monitor has been flickering since the moment I unboxed this product. I recently bought new HDMI cables to make sure that they weren't the reason for the issue. Unfortunately, the issue is coming from somewhere within the monitor. I called Amazon and Samsung recently for support. Samsung recommended that I send the monitor in to be serviced. It will be in for service for at least two weeks being repaired. I was very disappointed with Samsung's level of service. I purposely bought a branded product and from Amazon because I expected better customer care.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: Lots has already been said about the quality of this monitor but I want to address Samsung's customer service, which has been pretty amazing. I have had three of these monitors for almost two years but recently, one developed a problem. Samsung immediately sent me a shipping label. I shipped the monitor to them on a Tuesday. I got it back, repaired on the following Friday at no charge and no shipping fees. Shortly after I got them, I had some questions about monitor settings and got excellent tech support from them. In each case, I got the impression that they were proud to make sure I got the best possible help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor except for one thing I can't figure out
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor except for one thing I can't figure out. I doesn't "go to sleep" like my previous monitor would. I've set the source to be manual, but it continues to search for input when I turn off my computer. When it does this, the screen flashes and the input source it's scanning is shown on the screen. It seems to know it's "sleeping" since the power button blinks, but it still turns the screen off and on. The only way to stop this is to turn it off. Otherwise, I love this monitor! Crisp display with a good resolution. It's not 4K, but I didn't need that. So, if Samsung is listening... can you fix the sleep mode? Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: John Carey

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed since it won't turn on when it goes to ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed since it won't turn on when it goes to sleep and I have to do a hard shut down and then restart the computer. I should have sent it back, but with personal things to attend to the thirty day return time elapsed so I can't return it. On the positive side, the picture quality is good, but, imho, not better than the other monitor I have, and I bought this monitor primarily for photo editing. I wouldn't recommend this monitor unless Samsung corrects the problem with the sleep mode issue.
customer_reviews.author: William H. Etheridge Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful monitor
customer_reviews.text: I've had this monitor for two and a half months. It replaced a 21" 1600x1200 monitor I've had for 10 years. I'm a programmer and finding monitors with greater than 1080 vertical resolution is tough unless you go to a monitor like this one. The picture quality is awesome and the sheer size and resolution took some getting used to, because I have to physically turn my head to see what popped up in the corner of the screen. Plenty of real estate for Visual Studio and the latest Doom game looks great. One minor complaint is the whites are a bit too bright. To compensate I set as many apps as I can to dark mode.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Henning

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Display!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor has a terrific display! Compared to a 32" 1920x1080 HD TV, the pixels appear much finer making text and other details much easier to read. It seems much crisper. Graphics and programs appear to be much smoother and seem to have a more finished look to them. Color was really close right out of the box without using the Eco display mode - the calibration produced a barely noticeable change in color. The extra resolution makes working with large photo's easier since there is more detail displayed compared to the TV. This monitor is well worth the purchase price and I would buy it again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and extremely useful.
customer_reviews.text: Gorgeous picture. I use it in portrait, alongside a 43" Phillips, also from Amazon. Awesome for "art stuff," like editing scans for publication, blowing up reference shots, or running a movie in the bottom third. I especially like it with image cataloging and management software. I'm painting an oil from an old photo of my daughter in period costume. On this monitor, I'm viewing at half life size, clear and pretty. It can show bits of glow off very light edges, against black backgrounds, but I've never noticed it in a video, and it has never bothered me. It's not light, but it adjusts well, and switches from landscape to portrait easily.
customer_reviews.author: Willtheartman

customer_reviews.title: The dreaded blackout issue
customer_reviews.text: After only two years I am shopping for another 32" monitor. This Samsung has started randomly blacking out for a couple of seconds, sometimes as often as every 30 seconds or so. None of the troubleshooting tips online worked, and Samsung tech support just said to send it somewhere to be repaired; they didn't even try to troubleshoot it. And I'm not the only one...do a search for Samsung blackout issues, and you will change your mind about wasting money on this piece of junk. Too many people have had problems.
customer_reviews.author: icarumba

customer_reviews.title: Excellent work monitors but Samsung Support/Warranty department is HORRIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these monitors for my new business and office. So far the quality is amazing and the options available on the monitor are great. 33 days in though, I have been watching one of monitors start to receive R/G/B pixels that have then completely died to black/no light. I missed the replacement with Amazon and have been working with a HORRIBLE Samsung Warranty department. My only regret buying these is how much of a nightmare it has been trying to get a $399 (when I purchased it) monitor fixed. Samsung seems to not care one bit about return customers.
customer_reviews.author: Kelby

customer_reviews.title: Never again!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this monitor. Too bad it only lasted a year and then quit. I thought it had a three year warranty but apparently that was only if you lived in Europe. Won’t be buying Samsung again.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Great
customer_reviews.text: This screen is great. I bought it as a replacement for my old LG 32" 1080p monitor, that I used for my work. Now everything is SO MUCH SHARPER, with this 2K screen. Actually, if you are going to use a 32" screen for computer/work purposes, a standard 1080p choice will not work in the long term; your eye are going to get so tired after prolonged use... I actually did the experiment and the difference I felt when I first use this 2K screen was huge! I would recommend this very reliable and good quality screen to every professional who wants to use a 32" screen, and takes their eyes seriously.
customer_reviews.author: UnderPi

customer_reviews.title: Great for somethings.. but HDMI is flickering.  Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this monitor for about 3 years now. At first, it was working great. I used all three inputs -- HDMI, DVI and Displayport and switch between them pretty regularly. But it's not working well anymore. Any kind of HDMI input will flicker and display static. Sometimes it goes away and sometimes not. It doesn't matter what computer I use, what cable I use -- the HDMI is broken and usable. It's disappointing. It's a nice big giant monitor and great for work and gaming... while it worked.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pond

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic screen, and fantastic service!
customer_reviews.text: I had this screen for about a year and a half I totally love it! The viewing angles are great, the colors are vivid, and it's HUGE. So I was very sad when I cracked the display by striking it with the back of a mop while cleaning. I thought it would be a complete loss. I called Samsung, and they said they'd be willing to fix it for a flat rate of $150 (Which included shipping both ways, taxes etc). I sent the screen out on Tuesday, and I'm using the replacement one to type this review on Friday. I will definitely shop Samsung for future displays.
customer_reviews.author: Lev Selector

customer_reviews.title: 2k perfect size and resolution.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this monitor and wow I like 2k resolution, it’s perfect for this size, in 4K everything would be too tiny. I set color to cool 1 mode, normal is too warm for me. Picture looks good, didn’t mess with any color settings. Really wish I would get it sooner. I am using 1080p 27” as a second monitor. I think two of them on my desk will be overkill.
customer_reviews.author: nate

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful monitor and works as expected. I did a full color calibration using a sensor and special calibration sensor, but it really didn't change the appearance much - making me think it is pretty accurate right out of the box. I downgraded one star because the unit I received appeared to have been opened and returned to Amazon, and was missing the power cable. It was also not as nicely packed as it would have been from the factory. Luckily I had another cable on hand, but I would have preferred a new unit, or a discount for an open box monitor. No complaints with the performance or quality of the monitor though.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Card

customer_reviews.title: Excellent screen, occasional issue with USB hub
customer_reviews.text: Excellent screen for very good price. I use it also for photo editing and other graphic related tasks. Only one issue: It occurred already a couple of times that the USB hub would cease working completely. In that case, you have to turn it off, unplug ALL cables, turn it on, and off again (this causes some kind of internal reset), then plug in all cables again and it works well again. It seems to happen with other Samsung products too, so I am not sure what the real problem is. But again: The screen itself is really good, I would STILL buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Richter

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of this monitor. I like the resolution. I like the price. So far - I'm very happy with it. The base is a little large, but I had planned to replace it with an arm anyways. Currently connected to my 2015 MacBook pro using the HDMI connection to the monitor. Took it out of the box, plugged it into my MBP, and everything worked. Sorry - I did need to change it from the default DVI to HDMI using the front panel buttons. No big deal - read the manual. =)
customer_reviews.author: Todd Ruch

customer_reviews.title: One excellent monitor. Great for Photography.
customer_reviews.text: My old View Sonic bit the dust and I needed a larger monitor. This was highly rated and I am so glad that I purchased. So easy to setup and I love the additional USB ports in back to charge my tech items. Great vivid color and love the 34 inch view. Can pop several windows at a time and view multiple items. This monitor has a very good viewing image and since I use this mainly for Photography work (editing), it is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Monitor with excellent color and contrast
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is used at home. As it is big enough to be a TV, it is larger than I thought. Great for movies! Can get multiple spreadsheets or documents at the same time. The base is heavy—I’m confident that it won’t fall over. Had multiple cables including HDMI to DisplayPort. Uncertain about durability given we have only had it for a week. Seller was great—everything arrived as predicted in the condition that I expected. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Roger S. Stienecker

customer_reviews.title: Monitor won't wake
customer_reviews.text: I can only give this monitor 4 stars for now because of a quirk. Windows turns monitors on standby after five minutes to save power. When I come back to the PC, only my 24" ViewSonic (set as second monitor) awakes. The Samsung monitor stays in standby mode. This is irritating... Not sure if it is worth requesting support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazons Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using PC and Mac as the two inputs, sharing a single mouse and keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Works great with ShareMouse, but took a bit to get it right. Mouse and keyboard must be connected to the PC. PBP works great. Mouse crosses between PC side and Mac side smoothly. Keyboard follows the mouse. Full screen switching inputs requires using the ShareMouse hotkey to manually switch the keyboard/mouse to the other computer, before or after switching the display. I use a trackpad on the Mac, and it continues to work, on the Mac only.
customer_reviews.author: Dale W Boss

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Monitor for productivity
customer_reviews.text: Probably not intended for serious gaming, since it's only 60 Hz, but the picture quality is excellent and it has a USB 3 hub integrated, plus the side-by-side feature to share the monitor between two computers is nice. One thing to note about the USB hub is that it has a "fast charge" mode, but when this mode is active, you can't transfer data. This is not a HUGE deal, since you can easily enable/disable fast charging from the onscreen menu, but it is worth mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Huge monitor and comes with high speed USB charging ports in the back!
customer_reviews.text: Monitor came well packaged and works well on both the HDMI and display port connection! I managed to use it with an IBM laptop and a MacBook Pro over the display port! There's also an ambient light sensor to automatically adjust the brightness depending on the indoor lighting conditions! Monitor is almost too big, but it's not too heavy. Colors are bright and there are no dead pixels. No built in speakers even though the HDMI says there's an audio connection. Works as expected so 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I have had it for less then a week and I love it. In the beginning the text in some ...
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is a real work horse. It also doubles as a TV and I needed a TV in my bedroom. I have had it for less then a week and I love it. In the beginning the text in some applications like messenger appeared to be "washed out" and less sharp and I was disappointed. I tried to find a way to fix it but I could not find one. Now I am used to the appearance of the text and I am ok with it. There is so much screen space I have the size set to 125%, great for viewing pictures.The internet is a whole different experience with a monitor this big.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Bliss

customer_reviews.title: 32" in a world of 27"ers... Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My Dell 3008WFP 30" monitor died a little while back after many years of faithful service, and after a couple days of online research I settled on this guy. Couldn't be happier. It's actually for my assistant's computer, which she does general internet stuff on as well as culling my images in PhotoMechanic. Extremely happy with the purchase, and the little bit of extra size is very welcome in a world that now seems to be ruled by 27 inchers. Will likely buy more of these in the future if they still make them when I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis Kronk

customer_reviews.title: The monitor has excellent contrast, color gamut
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review on this monitor hooked up to my Mac Pro Desktop Workstation. The monitor has excellent contrast, color gamut, and multiple useful inputs. I also have it hooked up to an older Mac Pro Desktop running Ubuntu linux. I feel that this monitor hits the sweet spot in terms of screen real-estate. It is large, and provides ample workspace, but you don't have to move your head around to see the whole screen. The monitor arrived on time and had no defects. Highly recommended. I am a professional web developer and spend many hours each day using this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Randall J Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: i'm very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: as my first LED, i'm very happy with it. looking at it straight on, however, is not the best picture. strangely, it's better viewed from an angle. this kind of hurts me inside. it's very well made, but, strangely, while they included the mounting plate to mount to a wall unit, they DID NOT include the hardware (ie: screws/bolts and washers) necessary for attaching it. so if it's your plan to wall mount it, be warned you'll have to make a trip to the hardware store for these parts. be sure to bring the mounting plate with you to get the correct size screws.
customer_reviews.author: Evigan

customer_reviews.title: Just great.
customer_reviews.text: The size seemed excessive initially but now I do not know how I could work with anything else before. Great for working with multiple documents or large spreadsheet. Good match between size and resolution - very comfortable pixel pitch, i.e. things look big enough but not excessive at 100% scale in Windows. Overall I'm very happy with this screen. Note I did not do any tests etc. and I do not see the point.However if there were real issues / dead pixels etc I would have noticed.
customer_reviews.author: Ruslan Suvorov

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, lots of connection options. However, text is ilegible at native resolution. Im sure this is a windows dpi scaling issue, however, this monitor also has pip, effects splitting into two monitors. Testing tomorrow..
customer_reviews.author: Lasrin

customer_reviews.title: It's a great monitor when it works
customer_reviews.text: It's a great monitor when it works. Sometimes I'm typing and it suddenly disconnects. Hey look the screen is black! I have to power cycle it a couple times to make it work again. Also it only works in 1 of my 4 displayports. Between these 2 problems, and some additional testing+observation, it seems like the hdmi cable is maybe a fraction of a mm too short to make good contact. Manufacturing defect. Still pretty good for the price, considering.
customer_reviews.author: matthew devney

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic monitor! Very stable base. Perfect resolution for the 32 inch form factor. Crisp display. Perfect for my work, school, gaming. Couldn't ask for more. The USB 3.0 ports on the back were just icing on the cake. Not a single other 32 inch display holds a candle to this thing, I tend to over research things and I ended up getting this beauty. Not disappointed even with my stringent standards. Last of all, amazing price for what you get
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: best work/productivity monitor
customer_reviews.text: this is one of the best monitors I have ever used. Not for the purpose of gaming. It's a productivity monitor for work. Doesn't even have speakers, but if you need a work monitor, this is the best thing you can get. Very good anti glare surface.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Sidz

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor to pair with a Mac Mini, watch TV, etc.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor. I have paired it with a Mac Mini and it really pops, I also have it hooked to a cable box so in a pinch I can watch my cable TV in my office as well due to the multiple inputs. I used the DVI one for the Mac and the HDMI for the cable box. As I have gotten a bit older and my eyes are not as good as they were, having this size monitor has been very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: buckaroo

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor - especially for the price. Good mix of business and gaming.
customer_reviews.text: Had it a couple of weeks and so far great. Replaced two 27" one of which was dying. Only issue was the accompanying software. Magic rotation and easy box. I disabled those as they seemed to be polling the monitor and causing it to try to wake-up from a sleep state. This monitor has it all. Tilt, swivel, height adjustments and it rotates to profile mode. No dead pixels that I can detect. Also works well for gaming - Witcher 3, Fallout 4. Lost a couple of frames per second from my Nvidia GTX 970 but expected that with twice number of pixels to refresh.
customer_reviews.author: Jquedup

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect for my 2012 MacMini
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for my 2012 MacMini. I bought a $10 Amazon mini-Displayport to Display port cable so I could connect with 2560x1440 resolution (my Mac can only support 1080p via HDMI). However, to my surprise the monitor came with a mini-displayport to Displayport dongle. I hate dongles so I'll keep the cable. The set up menus are as confusing as all other monitors but looks great out of the box. I haven't tried the PIP feature.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Liberty

customer_reviews.title: Good to Great monitor for coding - needed to use "sharpness" setting.
customer_reviews.text: I got this monitor a few days ago to become the center screen for software development. Before I had three 1920x1080 but with this I have 2560x1440 in the center and it's a big step up for looking at code (more lines per page) or side-by-side views (more width per line). At first, the text didn't seem sharp enough but after some playing with the settings, I found the "Samsung MAGIC Upscale Mode 1" to be the sharpest.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor. Vey impressed with the clarity and detail. This replaced my 27 inch Acer 1920 X 1080. I did turn down the brightness to about 70, but haven't done any other calibration yet. Samsung included high quality cables with the monitor so I didn't have to buy anything else. Right now I'm driving it from a Gigabyte BRIX while a rearrange my office.
customer_reviews.author: Shifty

customer_reviews.title: Great display; huge
customer_reviews.text: Huge display. Good Samsung quality. Mine does black out once in a while, but I can't say it's the display as it could be the displayport cable that I'm using. I'll update this if I confirm the display is the issue. Until and if that point comes, I really love this unit. I've had it for a couple of months now. Primarily used as a display for my MacBook Pro (13", late 2013 model) and is fantastic. It also gets used for a PS4 and occasionally for a Raspberry Pi.
customer_reviews.author: JMT

customer_reviews.title: Stays ON 24-Hours a day.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for work and it stays on 24-hours a day in the shift supervisor's office; mostly with static graphics and the frequent use for looking at different graphics. The size is ideal for displaying computer graphics for a mid-sized office where most of the viewing is from about 3-10 ft away. We are using the DP connection and the colors, contrast, and brightness are extremely good in the well lit office. Overall this is a very good reliable monitor so far, and I wish I could get one for my workstation too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: O&A Resto

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for office work
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for a large office monitor. Lets me work with multiple programs simultaneously without having to resize them or move windows around. Text size at 1440 is fine for office work. Stand is great, very stable and it is easy to move monitor up and down and turn side to side. Highly recommend if you want a large monitor for office work.
customer_reviews.author: Country Lawyer

customer_reviews.title: Great, then eh
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this I would have given it 5 stars. Sexy, sleek and thin. Big and clear. USB 3.0 hub. 2K resolution works with my video card. It's as large as I can possibly fit into my desk space. Months later 2 problems arose: it blacks out for 3 seconds every once in a while, and in still pictures sometime red areas glow full blown bright magenta. Now it is completely usable, but these are signs it's going to die on me a bit earlier than a monitor should.
customer_reviews.author: Thevaluator

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 years of light use
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these monitors 5 years ago and had been happy until one of them broke. The power entry point on the back is broken. Anyway the warranty was only three years and to get it fixed it’s going to cost me another $150 plus I would have to box it up and get it to ups. Not worth it. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam

customer_reviews.title: Best business / graphic monitor you can get
customer_reviews.text: This is just an excellent monitor. Color is great and very neutral and the picture quality is brilliant. Blacks are nice and dark and there is no weird bleed through. I use it for photo editing so all that is very important. It pivots effortlessly and is very easy to turn into portrait mode for long spreadsheets etc. I don't use that function often because I have an external web cam located on the top, but it does work nicely. The monitor bezel looks very business like and all round this is the best monitor I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Display Port beautiful, HDMI questionable (looking into it)
customer_reviews.text: Using for 7 months and still as good as new. Zero dead pixels. Using it with Amazon FireStick is great too. DISPLAYPORT looks great. DVI is working fine. Only thing is with HDMI, there is some kind of banding (horizontal lines flashing across screen a lot) when I have it plugged into its HDMI. I will make sure it's not my cable or the graphics card, but I am a little concerned if the DP connection ever sh*ts the bed like it has for some reviewers.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best monitor I've ever purchased... Period!!!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is that I love this monitor. The picture is very high definition, the colors are wonderful, and the construction with beautiful metal is incredible. It has an electronic eye somewhere that allows the monitor to dim and brighten if you turn your room light on or off. This is a very cool feature. Almost everything is automated in the monitor; therefore, all you have to do is plug it in and then view the wonderful resolution and huge screen.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: This monitor momentarily stopped working after 3 years, and came back to life after half an hour.
customer_reviews.text: The Samsung SD850 32" WQHD (2560x1440) monitor died after three years. Update: Well it didn't die, it did stop responding for at least 30 minutes. After unplugging, replugging, and a moving it around a bit it cam back to life. Hopefully it stays that way.
customer_reviews.author: NuclearFirestorm

customer_reviews.title: Eye strain
customer_reviews.text: Calibrating this monitor for color accuracy has been difficult and the dots are huge. I would not recommend this monitor for text input or web development as you need to be sat about 4 ft away to not see the huge dots. Edge of text is blurred or jagged - no in-between.
customer_reviews.author: Jaydee

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor.
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought it was way too big but now I love the size as I already got use to it. My older 17" screen looks like a tablet screen next to this. Reason for one less star is that I, too, have that strange scratches on the upper back side as mention by another user. I seriously thought about returning it because of it as it looks either used or returned item. But zero dead pixel made me keep it as what matters is the front. It's is set at 2560 x 1440 with 60hz via Display Port. No issue playing 1080P youtube videos.
customer_reviews.author: B.H.

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product
customer_reviews.text: This monitor arrived defective, as you can see in the photo. Amazon would not replace it because its sold by a third party, so had to return it. Calling Dell instead.
customer_reviews.author: p thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: I needed a large monitor for large clear text (a writer needs to see it all, lean back and think and still see the text) and sharp, clear photos for photographic work. If you need big, sharp, high quality, and functionality, this (32 inch) is a good choice. I do find the menu manipulation a bit confusing, but then there is a great deal in our modern technological world that is confusing to those of us of a certain age...
customer_reviews.author: Martin A. Moe

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this monitor. It does exactly what I expected it to do and has a very clear picture, whether watching movies or playing games you will not be disappointed. I love that it can rotate from horizontal to vertical and has quite a height range to adjust it's height.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: What a solid monitor. I had a 27" 1080p for 9 years but it was getting dim. Been looking around for years and then settled on this gem. No dead pixel, 1440 is just wow for working. Text is so much sharper. I dont play graphic intensive games so I cant comment. But LoL is solid on it. Couldnt be happier. Other comments: qualitybis good, extremely minimal and even bleeding, color is good, built sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Auto-detect Doesn't Always Work
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the display port and it doesn't always work. While it shows that it is on display port I have to cycle through all the ports and come back for it to show. Does this about 30-40% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: CarlU

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these as my work setup. Superior picture quality/colors. I work with CAD, PDF, and other photo editing programs. I was so satisfied by my initial order and I had ordered this for the second time. I calibrated the monitors to get the most out of it. For the price, size , and quality, I am happy with the purchase decision. Note: it is a heavy and large monitor, so make sure you have enough desk space, especially if you plan to use duo-monitor setup.
customer_reviews.author: JIA

customer_reviews.title: Built like a champion
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sturdy build quality, especially the stand which is heavy so it would be hard to tip over monitor. Can raise, lower, tilt, and swivel monitor with one finger. Extremely happy with my decision to buy this monitor. Loaded with features not listed here. Samson counts this as a business class product on this item too so extra built in warranty. Using with Win 7, Adobe CC suite, and a Gt 1060.
customer_reviews.author: stonecircle

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a much older 32" Samsung with this model. No dead pixels and no lines or splotches (I guess I won the quality lottery.) Image is crisp, no noticeable artifacts while gaming. PIP works well when needed. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I have a 32" Dell monitor that set me back $1200 that does not compare to this Samsung montior. The picture quality is much better on the Samsung. The design is way nicer on the Samsung as well. Will be buying another to replace my Dell so I can have matching montiors.
customer_reviews.author: WCKTSS

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: As usual Samsung exceeds my expectations; color, size, sharpness, controls, appearance. A major upgrade for me from my 25" Samsung. Now very easy to put two or three Word pages side by side, or browser and spreadsheet (and maybe Word) together. Now I feel more professional. :)
customer_reviews.author: Culture Man

customer_reviews.title: whose review began "I know my monitors – and this one is fantastic..
customer_reviews.text: Spectacular monitor! Not much to add beyond what's already in the reviews. I looked at many options, and I'm esp. grateful to the review by Kiyoshi Matsutsuyu on October 15, 2014, whose review began "I know my monitors – and this one is fantastic..." I was pleasantly surprised to see that my graphics cards already supported this resolution. Be sure to check that before buying any 4K monitor. I work in extremely high-end CAD for my job, and this works fantastically well. I was also pleasantly surprised that my CAD software supported this high of a resolution, as it has a high-res mode for printing, which I now use all the time.
customer_reviews.author: John Van Drie

customer_reviews.title: and I'm extremely happy with the build quality of Samsung
customer_reviews.text: Tried a few monitors before selecting this one, and I'm extremely happy with the build quality of Samsung, the excellent resolution, beautiful color reproduction. The entire product is top notch. I love everything about it. I had originally tried a 34" LG Ultra-wide, but the resolution isn't supported by most games and couldn't be utilized. This is the best monitor I've owned over the last 20+ years (and I've had a number of them). Don't skimp and settle for a cheaper no-name brand ... go Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Really Really Nice Monitor!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received my monitor a few days ago and am amazed by what I have been missing out on!!! No more cheap little monitors for me! I cannot describe how great everything looks on this monster! Trust me, you would have to see to believe!!! 5 Stars!!! Update!!! I've had this monster for three weeks now. I am extremely happy I bought it and have had no issues with it! No light bleed! No dead pixels! If I had the money i'd buy 2 more! Great monitor!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chustco

customer_reviews.title: Sustained for more than 2 years, still better than other Samsung products that I used to own
customer_reviews.text: I used to like Samsung products, until I realized that my luck with Samsung products was below average. This one was the last from Samsung. While I was happy with the product, it cannot accept signals from DVI or DisplayPort any longer after 2 years and 11 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ahn

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR PEOPLE WHO WORK ON DOCUMENTS
customer_reviews.text: The size and resolution are such that it's just like having two 8 1/2" by 11" documents on the screen at the same time, with room to do some other stuff, too. It works great with my late 2011 MacBook Pro as an external monitor. This is even better than having two separate monitors. You'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Walter W.

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy! Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great monitor. I'm happy that the height can be adjusted and the screen tilted. Resolution is perfect for me and I use it with external speakers. I like that it comes with 4 USB ports on the side. Definitely recommend it. Great value for the price. I use it for graphics, 3d design programs.
customer_reviews.author: K. Friderici

customer_reviews.title: Blanking screen
customer_reviews.text: After about 1.5 months now, monitor has begun to flicker. What began as a split second flash of complete darkness, now has monitor going blank 3-5 seconds and automatically recover 1-2 times in a 8 hour period. With this constantly increasing duration, I am returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Umesh Biradar

customer_reviews.title: Great Price-Value 32" Monitor.
customer_reviews.text: After 2 monitors with scratches and dust under the screen I finally got one that was fine. I still give 5 stars because the monitor is great for this price. Nice resolution and response time, colors are very accurate. Great value monitor with a lot of features (HDMI, DisplayPort, DVI-D USB 3.0, PIP etc.) The stand comes pre-attached with nice ergonomics. Better quality control on Samsung's side would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew James

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Nice and Sharp and Clean
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I was hesitant to buy this because I have an old MAC tower 2010 mid July 8 core. There is no display port on my MAC but a DVI and even the DVI looks great. Sharp, Bright and BIG! Looks good for photography, music composing, games, movies. Someday I will fool around with an adapter for Display port or even get a better graphics card. I give it 5 stars but could be a 4.5.
customer_reviews.author: Stellar Dust

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Picture
customer_reviews.text: Someone else's review said 32" is the sweet spot for a monitor with this resolution. It certainly seems perfect to me. The colors are vibrant, and the picture is crisp for office work or videos.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Very good monitor. Have had it for years.
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor! I have been using it for years now. Its great all though playing games on it up close easily makes me motion sick. Maybe a smaller monitor is better for gaming but it is nice having such a big screen. I dont know if I would like a smaller screen to game on.
customer_reviews.author: foxxsoup

customer_reviews.title: Just having the extra screen space makes everything better. Shipping and packaging were excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've had this monitor for a year. Absolutely no problems. I have it connected to a Aten 2-Port USB DVI Dual View KVMP Switch (CS1642A) switch so I can utilize the monitor for my work laptop (Lenovo T450). The laptop supports the resolution of this monitor. Viewing excel spreadsheets enhanced. Just having the extra screen space makes everything better. Shipping and packaging were excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D

customer_reviews.title: Blinks randomly.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this due to blinking. The replacement does the same thing, but now I'm stuck with it. I've tried replacing the cables, but nothing works. The monitor seems to be the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tristin A

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had speakers
customer_reviews.text: I would give this a 5 star rating if it had speakers. I don't always want to use my surround sound speakers for videos and other things. Otherwise, this is a great monitor. Picture is always great. Settings are easy to use. It does need another HDMI port though.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Brann

customer_reviews.title: SAME AS MY COMPUTER MONITOR AT THE OFFICE- LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily for my job as an insurance adjuster. It's the exact same model my large company just bought for us in our brand new building, so I know it's a great model since they picked it, too. I love it. Worth every penny now that I'm working from home every day.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Wipperfurth

customer_reviews.title: excellent picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Clean, sharp, excellent picture quality. The accompanying hardcopy of instructions and diagrams, however, is scant and difficult to read. I haven't been able to get help from the DVD, but that may be my fault. I want to lower the brightness, and the menu tells me changing the brightness is not available. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Duke Robinson, author of Standing On My Head ... With My Fly Open

customer_reviews.title: Poor Eyesite leads to Fantastic Large Monitor.
customer_reviews.text: This large monitor was just what I needed for work purposes. Especially when you are working with so many spreadsheets, this monitor makes it so easy to refer to everything arranged on the screen. A very sturdy product that was easy to put together and hook up to my computer. It literally took me minutes before I was ready to begin using it and reviewing spreadsheet. Great Product.
customer_reviews.author: Christine D (Fuhngirl)

customer_reviews.title: Very worth it
customer_reviews.text: I don't spend $400 everyday but when I do, it needs to be a substantial upgrade. Before this, I was using a 28" (I thought it was 32") LED 1080p TV as my 2nd monitor and gaming screen. The size surprised me as I had my sizing wrong in my head, which is fantastic! This monitor also has a much higher resolution, while I can't fully utilize it yet with my crappy vcard and original Xbox one. Having the higher resolution does make it look much more clear however. This was definitely worth it. When making the transition, I did need to get an HDMI audio extractor and use some speaker with it since I came from a TV.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wright

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I downgraded from an Asus 28" UHD monitor to a Samsung 32" QHD cause I couldn't stand the small text / finer resolution on the 28" screen. The Samsung monitor was well packaged (box is large) and works perfectly. Its nice to have a stand that swivels and allows you to position the monitor in both portrait and landscape mode.
customer_reviews.author: mmp151

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife's Surface Pro. Wish there was a 32 inch touch screen but couldn't find one. This one though is great for seeing details.
customer_reviews.author: Gary_in_Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: Incredible monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible monitor. My first thought when unpacking the monitor was: "This might be too big". Once I got it placed on my desk, I was in awe. I haven't had much time to play with the settings yet but am looking forward to fine tuning this thing. I was debating between this and the LG ultra wide 34" and am glad I went with this one. You just can't appreciate the size of this monitor until you see it in person.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Monitor, Excellent service
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is amazing. Came with all the cables and looks brand new! Reached out to seller for question about hdmi and sound and he immediately offered a solution with a very understanding tone. Can’t thank this kind of customer service enough, best I can do is to at least write a review.
customer_reviews.author: Scriptures

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 37 days!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Dead in 37 days!!!!! Not much else to say. After 37 days, it just will not turn on anymore. No light, no signal, nothing as if it is not plugged in. I went around the house and tried at least a dozen different outlets so power source is not the problem. For a monitor that costs more than $500, you would not expect it to fail after 37 days. I have always been a Samsung user but this is just a huge letdown for me. I am contacting the customer service and we will see how well they can resolve this.
customer_reviews.author: Spiderkiller9

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this monitor for a month now and it is working great. The up/down and tilt adjustments are really useful. The screen size allows me to work with two programs side-by-side with no problems. It came with a single dead pixel (or frozen, I'm not sure). That isn't much, especially for a monitor this size.
customer_reviews.author: i32rockman

customer_reviews.title: Perfection itself.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is absolutely amazing. Incredible color and white/black depth. I had a Samsung TV I used as a monitor before, and thought it was good, this thing blows it out of the water. Just about as big as you would want from a single desk monitor if you're a couple feet from it, and the resolution means you can spread your windows out well and still have great visibility. As someone who spends eight or more hours a day in front of a computer screen, believe me, this monitor is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor. I have been using it the last 1 1/2 months for TV instead of my 60" wide screen and it works great. The only problem I find is that at native rez (2560 x 1440) the text gets so small on TV, movies, games that I can't read it with my tired old eyes. Windows lets you adjust that when using it with the PC though.
customer_reviews.author: White Woof

customer_reviews.title: These monitors are awesome. They are big and I have them positioned ...
customer_reviews.text: These monitors are awesome. They are big and I have them positioned vertically (portrait, not landscape). They fit my purpose well and the price on Amazon was unbeatable. They came with lots of connector cables which saved me some money and they came packed very well. No damage or anything like that. Would recommend to anyone looking for a monitor!
customer_reviews.author: Saagar Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: this was my first 2k monitor, and it rocks! the packing was made so that it could be air dropped from 10,000 feet without suffering any ill effects. The picture is vivid, and blacks are black.
customer_reviews.author: JRS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: Clear, bright and excellent detail corner to corner. I can get more than 2 full 8.5" x 11" pages up on screen at the same time. Integrates perfectly with the Macintosh PowerBook Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Rees

customer_reviews.title: Perfect monitor for me
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful monitor for work or video. It's been flawless for a week now with zero setup required to run with my Macbook Pro Retina. Setup buttons are clear and well documented onscreen so no real need for manual. Comes with 4 cables, a wall-mount bracket, and a stable stand that flips from landscape to portrait, tilts, swivels and elevates. For work with text documents, it has as many pixels as I could possibly see, and all are crisp with good contrast and more brightness than I'll need. I can't imagine wanting anything more, though I don't do video games.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Great for coding, gaming, web browsing
customer_reviews.text: I've used this monitor since March 2016. It's been perfect. I use it for software development, gaming, and web browsing. My eyes almost never get strained, and that's saying a lot since I'm on it for a full work day every day.
customer_reviews.author: 1shot

customer_reviews.title: Superb high-res monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is one heck of a good monitor. I'm really impressed with the naturalness and detail of the picture when using the highest resolution (not all graphics cards support it, though). Very easy on the eyes, almost like looking at a large, well-printed sheet of paper. And good for video, too. They don't mention it, but the stand is easily adjustable vertically, which helps me because I'm using the monitor on a standing-desk contraption and it would be too high if the stand weren't adjustable. It also rotates to portrait if you need that. All very well built and high quality. (What a relief!)
customer_reviews.author: Peter in the southwest

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, great TV!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor came quick! It was packed very well thank you Amazon. The monitor is beautiful and I'm very happy with my purchase. Tax return money well spent!:) Blueray movies look excellent, my low res 1920x1080 computers look nice on it too. The swivel ability side to side and up/down allows you to point the monitor toward where you are viewing it. Sitting on the couch or at the desk this monitor is great. The monitor also swivels to portrait mode but I haven't used this mode yet.
customer_reviews.author: F. Roller

customer_reviews.title: This monitor has been nothing but fine. I literally don't know what to complain about
customer_reviews.text: This monitor has been nothing but fine. I literally don't know what to complain about. The size upgrade makes everything more enjoyable. I have put a fair amount of hours on this 7 days a week and it looks the same, bright to the edges. If I had a smaller monitor I would have gotten my cataracts fixed sooner but I can't blame it for making things easier to read.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Horner

customer_reviews.title: I have hundreds of hours looking at the same interior of a high quality B737 simulator and I was amazed at the improvement by si
customer_reviews.text: Expected an improvement but WOW! Moved up from a Samsung 23-in using a GTX980Ti video card primarily for flight simulation (P3Dv3). I have hundreds of hours looking at the same interior of a high quality B737 simulator and I was amazed at the improvement by simply changing monitors. Perfect size for desktop too, not sure I'd be as happy with a larger screen.
customer_reviews.author: D. Downs

customer_reviews.title: two defective units?
customer_reviews.text: first one arrived with a large shadow covering about 1/8 of the total screen. Replacement arrived, worked fine for a week and now has a green vertical line running through the screen. I give up.
customer_reviews.author: hutchij

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: We are using them for GPS, watching TV, using as a monitor for a PC and no matter what we use them for they have been great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: so I needed to utilize a wall mount to get the last 6-8" of space I needed to be visually comfortable. Your mileage may vary
customer_reviews.text: Heavy for a monitor. Buy a quality wall mount should you plan to use one. I upgraded from a 24" monitor which I sat 34-36" (3 feet) away from. Now I sit 46-48" (4 feet) back, so I needed to utilize a wall mount to get the last 6-8" of space I needed to be visually comfortable. Your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore King

customer_reviews.title: good screen, good price, so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I have had this monitor for about a month now and so far it seems to be working great. I have it hooked up through HDMI to my 2014 Macbook pro and I love it. I do video and photo editing so having the clear, precise picture is important. This screen does exactly what I need it to do and looks great while doing it. I can't speak to its longevity, yet, but so far I really dig this screen and at a good price, too.
customer_reviews.author: Boof

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Best
customer_reviews.text: The Samsung 32" WQHD LED monitor is among the best that I have I've seen in my 35 years of computing. The device runs every application flawlessly. I have not encountered any difficulties in the 6 weeks that it has been running at my home. It performs perfectly. People that have trouble with this monitor, I would suggest that the problem is in their video card.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mills

customer_reviews.title: Rockin' 2560 x 1440 Through DVI Dual Link
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy. Able to run an older desktop at 2560 x 1440 with a DVI Dual Link. Note, you have to get a DVI Dual Link cable. Most DVI cables are Single Link, and that won't get you the higher resolution. Google it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kelley
